explanation:The combination of sneezing and nasal congestion suggests an upper respiratory viral infection like the common cold. Hypotension
vomiting and incontinence would be atypical additional symptoms.}
explanation:Sneezing and nasal congestion are common symptoms of allergic rhinitis (hay fever). The other symptoms would not typically be present.}
incontinence. Upper respiratory symptoms like sneezing and congestion are possible but less common.}
explanation:Disorders of the autonomic nervous system can lead to hypotension
and sometimes GI symptoms like vomiting. Sneezing and congestion would be unusual.}
explanation:Food-borne illnesses can cause acute vomiting and sometimes hypotension or incontinence
but upper respiratory symptoms like sneezing and congestion would not be expected.}
hypotension and vomiting. Sneezing and congestion are not typical symptoms.}
explanation:Severe stress and anxiety can sometimes lead to physical symptoms like hypotension
and incontinence. Sneezing and congestion would be atypical.}

congestion and incontinence are not characteristic symptoms.}
explanation:A backup of urine caused by a kidney obstruction can lead to incontinence
hypotension and vomiting. It doesnt cause sneezing or congestion.}

hypotension and overflow incontinence. Upper respiratory symptoms would not be expected.}
